revision.text: {{talkheader}} {{Article history | action1 = GAN | action1date = 07:57, 21 September 2012 (UTC) | action1link = Talk:Russian battleship Pobeda/GA1 | action1result = listed | action1oldid = 513823866 |action2=WAR |action2date=08:56, 27 July 2014 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Russian battleship Pobeda |action2result=approved |action2oldid=618504376 | currentstatus = FA | topic = War |action3=FAC |action3date=21:02, 29 September 2014 (UTC) |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Russian battleship Pobeda/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=623175719 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military History|class = FA|A-Class=pass|Maritime=yes|Japanese=yes|Russian=yes|WWI=yes|OMT=1}} {{WikiProject Japan|class = FA|importance=low|milhist=y}} {{WikiProject Shipwrecks|importance=|class = FA}} {{WikiProject Russia|class = FA|importance=Low|hist=yes|mil=yes|tech=yes}} {{WikiProject Ships|class = FA}} }} == Pobeda is misspelled. == Though "Pobeda" and "Pobeida" seem to be used interchangeably, I believe the most correct spelling is "Pobeida", or so says Jane's Fighting Ships: 3rd Edition. I am new to Wikipedia and would correct the spelling of the title myself if I new how :-/ [[User:HarbingerCMT|HarbingerCMT]] ([[User talk:HarbingerCMT|talk]]) 17:03, 23 August 2009 (UTC) == Lead image == Given there's three images of the Pobeda in the article, why is the lead image of a different ship? '''[[User:Adam Cuerden|Adam Cuerden]]''' ([[User talk:Adam Cuerden|talk]]) 11:02, 29 September 2014 (UTC) :Because it's the best one that shows the layout of the ship. If you want to swap it out for the bow-on view pic I won't object.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 17:08, 29 September 2014 (UTC)
